commit.message:
configure.in (i?86-UnixWare7*-sysv): Set thread_file to 'posix' --enable-threads[={yes,pthreads,posix}] is passed as...

Thu Apr 29 22:13:46 1999  Robert Lipe  <robertlipe@usa.net>
	* configure.in (i?86-UnixWare7*-sysv): Set thread_file to 'posix'
	--enable-threads[={yes,pthreads,posix}] is passed as a command
	line parameter to configure.
	* config/i386/sysv5.h (LIB_SPEC): Add support for '-pthread'.
	(CPP_SPEC): Likewise.

From-SVN: r26701

files.patch:
@@ -1,3 +1,11 @@
+Thu Apr 29 22:13:46 1999  Robert Lipe  <robertlipe@usa.net>
+
+	* configure.in (i?86-UnixWare7*-sysv): Set thread_file to 'posix'
+	--enable-threads[={yes,pthreads,posix}] is passed as a command
+	line parameter to configure.
+	* config/i386/sysv5.h (LIB_SPEC): Add support for '-pthread'.
+	(CPP_SPEC): Likewise.
+
 Thu Apr 29 17:23:59 1999  Richard Henderson  <rth@cygnus.com>
 
 	* emit-rtl.c (operand_subword): Religiously mask and sign-extend

@@ -2149,6 +2149,7 @@ else
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
     builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
 char $ac_func();
+char (*f)();
 
 int main() {
 
@@ -2158,12 +2159,12 @@ int main() {
 #if defined (__stub_$ac_func) || defined (__stub___$ac_func)
 choke me
 #else
-$ac_func();
+f = $ac_func;
 #endif
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2167: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:2168: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -2192,12 +2193,12 @@ done
 #AC_CHECK_TYPE(wchar_t, unsigned int)
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for vprintf""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2196: checking for vprintf" >&5
+echo "configure:2197: checking for vprintf" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_vprintf'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2201 "configure"
+#line 2202 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char vprintf(); below.  */
@@ -2206,6 +2207,7 @@ else
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
     builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
 char vprintf();
+char (*f)();
 
 int main() {
 
@@ -2215,12 +2217,12 @@ int main() {
 #if defined (__stub_vprintf) || defined (__stub___vprintf)
 choke me
 #else
-vprintf();
+f = vprintf;
 #endif
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2224: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:2226: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_vprintf=yes"
 else
@@ -2244,12 +2246,12 @@ fi
 
 if test "$ac_cv_func_vprintf" != yes; then
 echo $ac_n "checking for _doprnt""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2248: checking for _doprnt" >&5
+echo "configure:2250: checking for _doprnt" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func__doprnt'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2253 "configure"
+#line 2255 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char _doprnt(); below.  */
@@ -2258,6 +2260,7 @@ else
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
     builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
 char _doprnt();
+char (*f)();
 
 int main() {
 
@@ -2267,12 +2270,12 @@ int main() {
 #if defined (__stub__doprnt) || defined (__stub____doprnt)
 choke me
 #else
-_doprnt();
+f = _doprnt;
 #endif
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2276: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:2279: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func__doprnt=yes"
 else
@@ -2308,15 +2311,15 @@ fi
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether the printf functions support %p""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2312: checking whether the printf functions support %p" >&5
+echo "configure:2315: checking whether the printf functions support %p" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_func_printf_ptr'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   gcc_cv_func_printf_ptr=no
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2320 "configure"
+#line 2323 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <stdio.h>
 
@@ -2329,7 +2332,7 @@ main()
   exit (p != q);
 }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2333: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:2336: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   gcc_cv_func_printf_ptr=yes
 else
@@ -2362,12 +2365,12 @@ case "${host}" in
   ;;
 esac
 echo $ac_n "checking for pid_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2366: checking for pid_t" >&5
+echo "configure:2369: checking for pid_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_pid_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2371 "configure"
+#line 2374 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -2396,17 +2399,17 @@ fi
 
 ac_safe=`echo "vfork.h" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for vfork.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2400: checking for vfork.h" >&5
+echo "configure:2403: checking for vfork.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2405 "configure"
+#line 2408 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <vfork.h>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:2410: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:2413: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -2431,18 +2434,18 @@ else
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working vfork""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2435: checking for working vfork" >&5
+echo "configure:2438: checking for working vfork" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_vfork_works'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   echo $ac_n "checking for vfork""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2441: checking for vfork" >&5
+echo "configure:2444: checking for vfork" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_vfork'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2446 "configure"
+#line 2449 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char vfork(); below.  */
@@ -2451,6 +2454,7 @@ else
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
     builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
 char vfork();
+char (*f)();
 
 int main() {
 
@@ -2460,12 +2464,12 @@ int main() {
 #if defined (__stub_vfork) || defined (__stub___vfork)
 choke me
 #else
-vfork();
+f = vfork;
 #endif
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2469: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:2473: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_vfork=yes"
 else
@@ -2487,7 +2491,7 @@ fi
 ac_cv_func_vfork_works=$ac_cv_func_vfork
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2491 "configure"
+#line 2495 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Thanks to Paul Eggert for this test.  */
 #include <stdio.h>
@@ -2582,7 +2586,7 @@ main() {
   }
 }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2586: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:2590: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   ac_cv_func_vfork_works=yes
 else
@@ -2610,12 +2614,12 @@ for ac_func in malloc realloc calloc free bcopy bzero bcmp \
 	strsignal putc_unlocked fputs_unlocked
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking whether $ac_func must be declared""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2614: checking whether $ac_func must be declared" >&5
+echo "configure:2618: checking whether $ac_func must be declared" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_decl_needed_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2619 "configure"
+#line 2623 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #include <stdio.h>
@@ -2648,7 +2652,7 @@ int main() {
 char *(*pfn) = (char *(*)) $ac_func
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2652: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:2656: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "gcc_cv_decl_needed_$ac_func=no"
 else
@@ -2677,12 +2681,12 @@ done
 for ac_func in getrlimit setrlimit
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking whether $ac_func must be declared""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2681: checking whether $ac_func must be declared" >&5
+echo "configure:2685: checking whether $ac_func must be declared" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_decl_needed_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2686 "configure"
+#line 2690 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #include <stdio.h>
@@ -2719,7 +2723,7 @@ int main() {
 char *(*pfn) = (char *(*)) $ac_func
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2723: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:2727: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "gcc_cv_decl_needed_$ac_func=no"
 else
@@ -2746,12 +2750,12 @@ done
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for sys_siglist declaration in signal.h or unistd.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2750: checking for sys_siglist declaration in signal.h or unistd.h" >&5
+echo "configure:2754: checking for sys_siglist declaration in signal.h or unistd.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_decl_sys_siglist'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2755 "configure"
+#line 2759 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #include <signal.h>
@@ -2763,7 +2767,7 @@ int main() {
 char *msg = *(sys_siglist + 1);
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2767: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:2771: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_decl_sys_siglist=yes
 else
@@ -2786,12 +2790,12 @@ fi
 
 # mkdir takes a single argument on some systems. 
 echo $ac_n "checking if mkdir takes one argument""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2790: checking if mkdir takes one argument" >&5
+echo "configure:2794: checking if mkdir takes one argument" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_mkdir_takes_one_arg'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2795 "configure"
+#line 2799 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #include <sys/types.h>
@@ -2808,7 +2812,7 @@ int main() {
 mkdir ("foo", 0);
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2812: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:2816: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   gcc_cv_mkdir_takes_one_arg=no
 else
@@ -3745,6 +3749,9 @@ for machine in $build $host $target; do
                tmake_file=i386/t-crtpic
                xmake_file=x-svr4
                extra_parts="crtbegin.o crtend.o"
+	       if test x$enable_threads = xyes; then
+		       thread_file='posix'
+	       fi
                ;;
 	i[34567]86-*-sysv4*)		# Intel 80386's running system V.4
 		xm_file="xm-siglist.h xm-alloca.h ${xm_file}"
@@ -6004,15 +6011,15 @@ fi
 
 
         echo $ac_n "checking for strerror in -lcposix""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6008: checking for strerror in -lcposix" >&5
+echo "configure:6015: checking for strerror in -lcposix" >&5
 ac_lib_var=`echo cposix'_'strerror | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
 LIBS="-lcposix  $LIBS"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6016 "configure"
+#line 6023 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -6023,7 +6030,7 @@ int main() {
 strerror()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6027: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6034: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var=yes"
 else
@@ -6046,12 +6053,12 @@ fi
   
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working const""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6050: checking for working const" >&5
+echo "configure:6057: checking for working const" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_const'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6055 "configure"
+#line 6062 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
@@ -6100,7 +6107,7 @@ ccp = (char const *const *) p;
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6104: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6111: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_c_const=yes
 else
@@ -6121,21 +6128,21 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for inline""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6125: checking for inline" >&5
+echo "configure:6132: checking for inline" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_inline'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_cv_c_inline=no
 for ac_kw in inline __inline__ __inline; do
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6132 "configure"
+#line 6139 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
 } $ac_kw foo() {
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6139: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6146: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_c_inline=$ac_kw; break
 else
@@ -6161,12 +6168,12 @@ EOF
 esac
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for off_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6165: checking for off_t" >&5
+echo "configure:6172: checking for off_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_off_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6170 "configure"
+#line 6177 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -6194,12 +6201,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for size_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6198: checking for size_t" >&5
+echo "configure:6205: checking for size_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_size_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6203 "configure"
+#line 6210 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -6229,19 +6236,19 @@ fi
 # The Ultrix 4.2 mips builtin alloca declared by alloca.h only works
 # for constant arguments.  Useless!
 echo $ac_n "checking for working alloca.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6233: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
+echo "configure:6240: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_alloca_h'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6238 "configure"
+#line 6245 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <alloca.h>
 int main() {
 char *p = alloca(2 * sizeof(int));
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6245: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6252: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_header_alloca_h=yes
 else
@@ -6262,12 +6269,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for alloca""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6266: checking for alloca" >&5
+echo "configure:6273: checking for alloca" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_alloca_works'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6271 "configure"
+#line 6278 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #ifdef __GNUC__
@@ -6295,7 +6302,7 @@ int main() {
 char *p = (char *) alloca(1);
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6299: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6306: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_func_alloca_works=yes
 else
@@ -6327,12 +6334,12 @@ EOF
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6331: checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks" >&5
+echo "configure:6338: checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_os_cray'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6336 "configure"
+#line 6343 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #if defined(CRAY) && ! defined(CRAY2)
 webecray
@@ -6357,12 +6364,12 @@ echo "$ac_t""$ac_cv_os_cray" 1>&6
 if test $ac_cv_os_cray = yes; then
 for ac_func in _getb67 GETB67 getb67; do
   echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6361: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:6368: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6366 "configure"
+#line 6373 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -6371,6 +6378,7 @@ else
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
     builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
 char $ac_func();
+char (*f)();
 
 int main() {
 
@@ -6380,12 +6388,12 @@ int main() {
 #if defined (__stub_$ac_func) || defined (__stub___$ac_func)
 choke me
 #else
-$ac_func();
+f = $ac_func;
 #endif
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6389: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6397: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
